value.title: AI deployments: Is your organization a transformer, pathseeker, starter or underachiever?
value.excerpt: AI-fueled organizations address strategy, operations, culture and change management and ecosystems, according to Deloitte's latest State of AI in the Enterprise report.

value.title: Salesforce’s Kathy Baxter and Amazon’s Nashlie Sephus talk keeping AI ethical at Enterprise scale
value.excerpt: AI and big data are an important part of most enterprise-scale companies now, but that very scale can make it difficult to employ them safely and ethically. Kathy Baxter at Salesforce and Nashlie Sephus at AWS have made ethical AI and data collection their business over the last few years,

value.title: Speechmatics pushes forward recognition of accented English
value.excerpt: Speech recognition has gone from convenient to crucial over the last few years as smart speakers and driving assist modes have taken off — but not everyone’s voice is recognized equally well. Speechmatics claims to have the most inclusive and accurate model out there,

value.title: Infrastructure and data issues hamper companies adopting AI, study finds
value.excerpt: More than three-quarters of companies say that they have AI models that never come into use. For 20% of companies, the numbers look even worse, with only 10% of their models making it into production.

value.title: GATC Health Corp chooses Syndi Health to accelerate artificial intelligence training and advance personalized medicine
value.excerpt: Syndi Health and GATC Health Corp today announced they have entered a development agreement, which could accelerate GATC Health's product development and publication release timelines by as much as 50 percent.

value.title: How machine learning speeds up Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Machine learning delivers insights in Power BI reports—and it enables you to get a large amount of data into your reports to generate those insights more quickly.

value.title: How Instoried Is Using AI To Turn Your Content Into Something People Actually Want To Read
value.excerpt: Enter Instoried, which is today announcing the completion of an $8m funding round as it launches its content enhancement platform in the US. Powered by artificial intelligence (AI), Instoried provides instant feedback on the written content created by businesses and individuals,

value.title: ICAIF'21 Showcases How Artificial Intelligence Is Transforming Finance
value.excerpt: ACM, the Association for Computing Machinery, will hold the 2nd ACM International Conference on AI in Finance (ICAIF'21), virtually from November 3-5, 2021. More than 950 people registered for the inaugural conference,

provider.name: Middle East North Africa Financial Network

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Models Predict How the Brain Processes Language
value.excerpt: Neuroscientists find the internal workings of next-word prediction models resemble those of language-processing centers in the brain.

value.title: Why Many People Are Turning Toward Robots And AI To Help Support Their Mental Health And Careers
value.excerpt: I interviewed Yvette Cameron, Oracle Cloud HCM senior vice-president, to learn more about how technology, artificial intelligence and robots can help workers with their mental health matters and careers.

value.title: Qualcomm unveils latest mobile chips for mid-range and budget devices
value.excerpt: Qualcomm has added four new Snapdragon mobile chips to its portfolio for both 4G and 5G-capable handsets at varying budget ranges. The Snapdragon 778G Plus 5G, 695 5G, 480 Plus 5G, and 680 4G chips are now official,

value.title: Teaching robots to think like us: Brain cells, electrical impulses steer robot though maze
value.excerpt: Can intelligence be taught to robots? Advances in physical reservoir computing, a technology that makes sense of brain signals, could contribute to creating artificial intelligence machines that think like us.

value.title: Vancouver Fraser Port Authority Improves Supply Chain Visibility With Computer Vision-Based Container Tracking
value.excerpt: With AWS Panorama, Deloitte is helping the port authority develop a new class of insights on its physical operations that will improve collaboration with supply chain partners.

value.title: Hai Robotics Wins NextGen Supply Chain Award
value.excerpt: Hai Robotics provides efficient, intelligent, flexible, and customized warehouse automation solutions through robotics technology and AI algorithms.

value.title: Photoshop update brings new Sensei AI features to desktop, Raw camera support to iPad
value.excerpt: Adobe MAX is here, and the company’s most popular editing software is unsurprisingly getting a host of updates for the occasion. The most significant updates are landing on Photoshop for desktop,

value.title: Adobe continues its AI push in Creative Cloud
value.excerpt: Over the course of the last few years, Adobe has gone all-in on AI. At its MAX conference this year, that’s once again on full display across updates for virtually all of its products, powered by its Sensei AI platform.

value.title: Cisco launches new AI-powered and hybrid event features for Webex
value.excerpt: Cisco has launched a range of new features for Webex, including AI-powered noise reduction and a 'wellness' portal for teams.

value.title: Facebook's new smart glasses may be impressive, but they also raise serious privacy and security concerns
value.excerpt: Consumers have raised concerns about the glasses' facial recognition technology, too-discreet recording feature, and data collection capacity.

value.title: Can Artificial Intelligence Take The Guesswork Out Of The Customer Journey?
value.excerpt: From shopping malls and sports arenas, to train stations and city streets, C2RO is an AI-powered video analytics platform that captures anonymized data about people’s movement so organizations can improve the customer experience.

value.title: AWS wins deal to store UK spy agencies' work, brings AI to the table
value.excerpt: The UK's spy agencies will move top secret data to AWS data centers and gain access to its artificial intelligence tools.

value.title: ITMO: ITMO Signs Russia’s First AI Ethics Code
value.excerpt: The first Russian AI code of ethics establishes general ethical principles and standards of conduct to guide those involved in activities using artificial intelligence. This has to do with ethical asp

value.title: The 3 Steps To Building An AI-Powered Organization
value.excerpt: Despite awareness about the potential of AI, leaders struggle to build an organization with AI at its core. The three-box solution helps organizations use AI to optimize their business today while innovating for exponential growth in the future.

value.title: PepsiCo hiring 150 in Dallas for new ‘digital hub’ leveraging AI and machine learning
value.excerpt: PepsiCo’s chief strategy and transformation officer describes the new high-tech team as a first for legacy consumer packaged goods brands.

value.title: Robotics-powered ‘microfulfillment’ startup Fabric raises $200M
value.excerpt: Fabric, a startup developing robotics- and software-powered microfulfillment technology, has raised $200 million in venture capital.

value.title: Amazon gets contract from British spy agencies to increase use of AI for espionage
value.excerpt: British spy agencies have signed a deal with Amazon Web Services to host classified material in a deal to boost the use of AI for espionage.
